page.title: 13Shopping and supplies
page.content: Local towns are small-less than 6000 population. Large towns that are visited include Hereford (very popular),Shrewsbury,Leominster,Ludlow, Telford, and Birmingham, but all involve distances from 20 to 80 each way and people must depend on their own transport. Local towns are expensive but there is a supermarket of considerable size "Harry Tuffins" in Knighton which almost everyone goes to regularly from a radius of up to twenty miles - the place sells almost everything. Many villages have a store and, perhaps, a post office but these are very expensive and are diminishing in number steadily.
